skillTree.localised_description: The horses of Norsca live for battle, even choosing to graze on the bones of the fallen over grass.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

skillTree.localised_description: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

skillTree.localised_description: Tainted and savage they may be, but these behemoths remain willing to bear high-status Marauders into battle, trampling flat everything foolish enough to get in their way.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

skillTree.localised_description: The slightest glance, the merest glimpse from one of the Dark Gods is sufficient to propel their playthings to ever-greater feats of desolation.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Dining upon the blood of slaughtered enemies may attract the notice, and maybe the favour, of the Hound.
The Great Hound of War thirsts eternally for blood and slaughter, its rage manifesting itself in the unstoppable martial spirit of its warriors.
The Hound's unearthly fury is personified by its Champions' thirst for war and hunger for unending blood and violence.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Thusly, the virulent maladies of the Crow are borne forth to repulse and infect its mortal foes; there lieth victory eternal.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: -10%
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: This foetid, disgusting pus is so repulsive to the untainted that it mimics traditional armour of far greater substance.
Unstable and miscreated, the Crow's strength spreads and grows like the most successful of diseases, consuming all before consuming itself and beginning again.
The Serpent's temptations come in many forms, all of them designed to appeal to the twisted desires buried deep within us all.
Seductive images of sensual luxuries may tempt the enemy from their chosen paths onto roads much, much less travelled and from which there can be no return.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -1
	(enemy armies in local region)

Enemy leadership: -2
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: Although the youngest of the Dark Gods, the Serpent is no less potent and can bind mortals to eternal service with alluring visions or tantalising temptations.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: More fool they who go to war and quest with minds unfocused, for they risk the Eagle's desolate, underhand deceptions.
The Eagle weaves a complex web of duplicity around its servants, further bracing their combat abilities in subtle, unexpected ways.
As the undisputed master of magic, the Eagle uses complex sorcery to influence its followers and draw opponents into his multifarious, interwoven schemes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: This one is known among the coastal cities.
Bring it all back! The plunder halls and slave camps will overflow!
Pathetic. Try again.
We will level their cities and burn their fields.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The warhounds range far and wide to hunt for food… and locate targets for their masters.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +50
	(Lord's army)

Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: ...so then I grabbed him by the trunk and threw him into the bay. Remember that next time you feel like whining about the cold.

effects.description:
Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +100
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

effects.description:
Speed: +6% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves and Marauder Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +9% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves and Marauder Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves and Marauder Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves and Marauder Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves and Marauder Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky – its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Manticore and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for Manticore and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Manticore and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Manticore and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Manticore and Chaos Frost Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Giant, deadly, and able to take orders, this Lord’s monstrosities are especially terrifying and lethal.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Fimir Warriors, Norscan Giant, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Fimir Warriors, Norscan Giant, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Fimir Warriors, Norscan Giant, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Fimir Warriors, Norscan Giant, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Fimir Warriors, Norscan Giant, Feral Mammoth, and War Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In spite of their savage nature, they are possessed of a savage code of conduct and form a loose brotherhood of those considered worthy.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Marauders, Marauder Spearmen, Marauder Berserkers, and Marauder Champions units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: No beast too large, no adversary too great; no quarry - mortal or otherwise - can evade them.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Marauder Hunters, Marauder Horsemen, and Marauder Horsemasters units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves and Marauder Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves and Marauder Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Norscan Warhounds, Norscan Ice Wolves, Manticore, Skin Wolves and Marauder Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 8% for Norscan Trolls, Norscan Ice Trolls, Chaos Frost Dragon, Norscan Giant, Fimir, Feral Mammoth and War Mammoth units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There can be no turning back for those whose souls are turning black.
There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +20% when laying siege or encircling
	(enemy armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +200
	(Lord's army)
Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(own armies in region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +25%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
Well built, robust. Powerful.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description:
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deformed from birth or made so by the Ruinous Powers, yet there is honour within the prison of flesh.
Such an ugly scar is always memorable.
Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.
Shares the intellect of a River Troll.
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee (150s)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The chieftains of the north are wild, fierce, and independent. They bear a thousand battle scars, and seek battle wherever it can be found.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 for all Mammoth units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The chieftains of the north are wild, fierce, and independent. They bear a thousand battle scars, and seek battle wherever it can be found.

Upkeep -20% for Norscan Giant unit
	(Lord's army)

Passive ability: "Drunken Bravado" for Norscan Giant unit
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

	(Lord's army)

When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.
